title: Awesome List Updates on Jan 10, 2023

items.title: Awesome Generative Deep Art
items.content_text:
### Generative AI history, timelines, maps, and definitions

*   \[üî•üî•üî•] [Mapping the Generative AI landscape | Antler](https://www.antler.co/blog/generative-ai)
*   \[üî•üî•üî•] [AI Timeline](https://www.fabianmosele.com/ai-timeline): A history of text-to-image ML models by Fabian Mosele
*   [AI-Generated Art](https://www.v7labs.com/blog/ai-generated-art): From Text to Images & Beyond Examples
items.content_html:
Generative AI history, timelines, maps, and definitions

  • [üî•üî•üî•] Mapping the Generative AI landscape | Antler
  • [üî•üî•üî•] AI Timeline: A history of text-to-image ML models by Fabian Mosele
  • AI-Generated Art: From Text to Images & Beyond Examples

Themes / superconsole - Windows-only

items.title: Awesome Neovim
items.content_text:
### Search / Diagnostics

*   [s1n7ax/nvim-search-and-replace (‚≠ê72)](https://github.com/s1n7ax/nvim-search-and-replace) - Search and replace in multiple files at the same time from the current working directory.

### Utility / Diagnostics

*   [j-morano/buffer\_manager.nvim (‚≠ê327)](https://github.com/j-morano/buffer_manager.nvim) - Add one or more buffers, reorder them, save them inside a file or just delete them very easily from a small floating window.

### Indent / Diagnostics

*   [LucasTavaresA/simpleIndentGuides.nvim (‚≠ê10)](https://github.com/LucasTavaresA/simpleIndentGuides.nvim) - Indentation guides using the builtin variables.
items.content_html:
Search / Diagnostics

  • s1n7ax/nvim-search-and-replace (‚≠ê72) - Search and replace in multiple files at the same time from the current working directory.

Utility / Diagnostics

  • j-morano/buffer_manager.nvim (‚≠ê327) - Add one or more buffers, reorder them, save them inside a file or just delete them very easily from a small floating window.

Indent / Diagnostics

  • LucasTavaresA/simpleIndentGuides.nvim (‚≠ê10) - Indentation guides using the builtin variables.

items.title: Awesome Quantified Self
items.content_text:
### Articles & Blogs

*   [QS Experiments](https://blog.kto.to) - Science-based approach for Quantified Self, sharing raw data and analysis, modelling physical processes, health trackers comparison and analysis.

### Applications and Platforms / Aggregators & Dashboards

*   [Vital](https://tryvital.io/) - Plaid like widget that joins together all your fitness data, wearables data and at home lab tests.

### Applications and Platforms / Wealth

*   [Firefly III (‚≠ê20k)](https://github.com/firefly-iii/firefly-iii) - A free and open source personal finance manager
items.content_html:
Articles & Blogs

  • QS Experiments - Science-based approach for Quantified Self, sharing raw data and analysis, modelling physical processes, health trackers comparison and analysis.

Applications and Platforms / Aggregators & Dashboards

  • Vital - Plaid like widget that joins together all your fitness data, wearables data and at home lab tests.

Applications and Platforms / Wealth

  • Firefly III (‚≠ê20k) - A free and open source personal finance manager

items.title: Awesome Nextjs
items.content_text:
### Boilerplates

*   [Hydrogen](https://statichunt.com/themes/nextjs-hydrogen) - Hydrogen is a Nextjs blog starter template build with tailwindCss and MDX supports. It has all necessary MDX shortcodes out of the box.
items.content_html:
Boilerplates

  • Hydrogen - Hydrogen is a Nextjs blog starter template build with tailwindCss and MDX supports. It has all necessary MDX shortcodes out of the box.

items.title: Awesome Jax
items.content_text:
### Models and Projects / Flax

*   [GNNs for Solving Combinatorial Optimization Problems (‚≠ê55)](https://github.com/IvanIsCoding/GNN-for-Combinatorial-Optimization) -  A JAX + Flax implementation of [Combinatorial Optimization with Physics-Inspired Graph Neural Networks](https://arxiv.org/abs/2107.01188).
items.content_html:
Models and Projects / Flax

  • GNNs for Solving Combinatorial Optimization Problems (‚≠ê55) - A JAX + Flax implementation of Combinatorial Optimization with Physics-Inspired Graph Neural Networks.

items.title: Awesome Productivity
items.content_text:
### Tools and Apps / Task Management

*   [OpenProject](https://www.openproject.org/) - An on premise open source project management solution that comes with a free community version as well as an enterprise version.
items.content_html:
Tools and Apps / Task Management

  • OpenProject - An on premise open source project management solution that comes with a free community version as well as an enterprise version.

items.title: Awesome Game Engine Dev
items.content_text:
### Game Engines / Awesome Collections

*   üìö [Wikipedia: List of Game Engines](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_game_engines) - Game engines along with their platforms and licenses.

### Game Engines / AAA

*   üí∞ [C4 Engine](http://c4engine.com) - Modern console engine.
*   üí∞ [Gamebryo](http://www.gamebryo.com) - Complete toolset, flexible workflow, rapid prototyping.
*   üí∏ [Unigine](https://unigine.com) - Real-time 3D engine. Photorealistic graphics, large virtual worlds, C++ and C# API.

### Game Engines / Commercial

*   üí∏ [Buildbox](https://www.buildbox.com) - Create 3D & 2D video games without coding.
*   üí∏ [GameSalad](https://gamesalad.com) - Sophisticated visual programming interface.
*   üí∏ [MANU](https://manu.co) - Unique animation system helps you create games without coding.
*   üí∏ [Roblox](https://www.roblox.com/create) - Create immersive 3D experiences with Lua scripting.
*   üí∏ [Simulation Starter Kit](https://benmorris.itch.io/plugin-based-scene-editor) - Create interactive 3D apps across a range of platforms.

### Game Engines / Specialty

*   üîí [HARFANG 3D (‚≠ê620)](https://github.com/harfang3d/harfang3d) - 3D visualization library for industry professionals, usable in C++, Python, Lua, Go.
*   üí∞ [RPG Maker](https://www.rpgmakerweb.com) - Create an original role-playing game without any specialized knowledge.

### Learning / Computer Graphics

*   Blog Articles
    *   üìö [Comparison of Modern Graphics APIs](https://alain.xyz/blog/comparison-of-modern-graphics-apis) - Modern graphics APIs vs older APIs.
    *   üìö [GPU Performance for Game Artists](http://www.fragmentbuffer.com/gpu-performance-for-game-artists/) - Common art-related performance issues.
*   Graphics API: DirectX
    *   üåé [DirectX](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/directx) - *Microsoft* API used to create 2D/3D games and apps. \[[Blog](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/directx/) | [Samples (‚≠ê6.5k)](https://github.com/microsoft/DirectX-Graphics-Samples)]
    *   üìö [DirectXTutorial.com](http://www.directxtutorial.com/default.aspx) - Older resource with lots of tutorials on DirectX versions 9 & 11.
*   Graphics API: OpenGL
    *   üìö [LearnOpenGL](https://learnopengl.com) üî• - Incredible! In depth tutorials for modern graphics programming.
    *   üåé [Mesa 3D](https://www.mesa3d.org/) - Open source implementations of OpenGL.
    *   üåé [OpenGL](https://www.opengl.org/) - The industry's foundation for high-performance graphics.
    *   üìö [OpenGL Tutorial](https://www.opengl-tutorial.org) - Collection of OpenGL tutorials with source code examples.
*   Graphics API: Vulkan
    *   üåé [Vulkan](https://www.vulkan.org) - Modern cross-platform graphics API. \[[Samples (‚≠ê4.8k)](https://github.com/khronosGroup/Vulkan-samples)]
    *   üìö [Vulkan Tutorial](https://vulkan-tutorial.com) - Teaches the basics of using Vulkan graphics and compute API.
*   Graphics API: WebGL
    *   üåé [WebGL](https://www.khronos.org/webgl/) - Open web standard 3D graphics API. \[[GitHub (‚≠ê2.7k)](https://github.com/KhronosGroup/WebGL)]
    *   üìö [WebGL Fundamentals](https://webglfundamentals.org) üî• - Full understanding of what WebGL really is and how it works.
    *   üìö [WebGL 2 Fundamentals](https://webgl2fundamentals.org) - Updated to use the WebGL2 standard.
    *   üìö [WebGL 2 Samples (‚≠ê1k)](https://github.com/WebGLSamples/WebGL2Samples) - Short and easy to understand samples demonstrating WebGL 2 features.
    *   üìö [WebGL Tutorial](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WebGL_API/Tutorial) - How to use the canvas element to draw WebGL graphics.

### Learning / Engine Development

*   Blog Articles
    *   üìö [How to Become a Game Engine Developer](https://www.haroldserrano.com/blog/how-to-become-a-game-engine-developer) - Starting point on game engine development.
*   Books
    *   üìö [Game Engine Architecture](https://www.gameenginebook.com) - Theory and practice of game engine development.

### Learning / Game Development

*   Awesome Collections
    *   üìö [Awesome Gamedev (‚≠ê2.7k)](https://github.com/Calinou/awesome-gamedev#readme) - Collection of free resources for making games.
    *   üìö [GameDev-Resources (‚≠ê4.3k)](https://github.com/Kavex/GameDev-Resources) - Wonderful list of game development resources.
    *   üìö [Magictools (‚≠ê15k)](https://github.com/ellisonleao/magictools#readme) - List of game development resources to make magic happen.
    *   üåé [Web Game Dev](https://www.webgamedev.com) - Resources on techniques and tools around JavaScript game development.
*   Books
    *   üìö [Art of Game Design](https://www.amazon.com/Art-Game-Design-Book-Lenses/dp/0123694965) - Teaches game design in an accessible manner.
    *   üìö [Game Programming Patterns](https://gameprogrammingpatterns.com) - Patterns found in games that make code easier to understand.
*   Developer Portals
    *   üåé [Game Developer](https://www.gamedeveloper.com) - Industry blogs, events, jobs, updates and more. Formerly *Gamasutra*.
    *   üåé [GameDev.net](https://www.gamedev.net/) - Game dev forums, tutorials, blogs, projects, portfolios, and news.
    *   üåé [GameFromScratch.com](https://gamefromscratch.com) - Game dev news, tutorials and much more.
    *   üåé [itch.io](https://itch.io) - Game dev resources and platform to showcase / promote / buy & sell games.
*   Education Portals
    *   üåé [Lazy Foo' Tutorials](https://lazyfoo.net/tutorials/SDL/) - Beginning game programming with SDL.

### Learning / Programming

*   üìö [Big-O Cheat Sheet](https://www.bigocheatsheet.com) - Big-O complexities of algorithms used in computer science.
*   üåé [Deadlock Empire](https://deadlockempire.github.io/#menu) - Interactive tutorial to master threads and concurrency.
*   üìö [Every Programmer Should Know (‚≠ê87k)](https://github.com/mtdvio/every-programmer-should-know) - Technical things every developer should know.
*   üìö [Games of Coding (‚≠ê2k)](https://github.com/michelpereira/awesome-games-of-coding#readme) - Games that teach you a programming language.
*   üåé [Geeks for Geeks](https://www.geeksforgeeks.org) - Tutorials, articles, courses, coding competitions, jobs and more.
*   üìö [Learn to Program (‚≠ê4.4k)](https://github.com/karlhorky/learn-to-program#readme) - Educational resources to learn to program.

### Libraries / C

*   C: Cross-Platform
    *   üéâ [Cosmopolitan (‚≠ê20k)](https://github.com/jart/cosmopolitan) - Build-once run-anywhere C library.
*   C: Entity Component System
    *   üéâ [Flecs (‚≠ê7.3k)](https://github.com/SanderMertens/flecs) - Fast and lightweight entity component system in C99.
*   C: File Formats
    *   üéâ [Assimp (‚≠ê12k)](https://github.com/assimp/assimp) - Open Asset Importer Library. Loads 40+ 3D file formats.
    *   üéâ [cgltf (‚≠ê1.6k)](https://github.com/jkuhlmann/cgltf) - Single-file glTF 2.0 loader and writer in C99.
    *   ‚≠ê [dr\_libs (‚≠ê1.4k)](https://github.com/mackron/dr_libs) - Single-file audio decoding libraries.
    *   üéâ [Libspng (‚≠ê789)](https://github.com/randy408/libspng) - Simple, modern libpng alternative.
    *   üéâ [Miniz (‚≠ê2.4k)](https://github.com/richgel999/miniz) - Single-file drop-in replacement for zlib's most used APIs (*libpng* and *libzip*).
    *   üéâ [OBJ GL Loader v2 (‚≠ê12)](https://github.com/karolek471/objgl) - Quite fast wavefront OBJ loader for OpenGL.
    *   üéâ [PL\_MPEG (‚≠ê857)](https://github.com/phoboslab/pl_mpeg) - Single-file library for decoding MPEG1 Video and MP2 Audio.
    *   üéâ [QOI (‚≠ê7.2k)](https://github.com/phoboslab/qoi) - The ‚ÄúQuite OK Image Format‚Äù for fast, lossless image compression.
    *   ‚≠ê [stb\_vorbis (‚≠ê29k)](https://github.com/nothings/stb/blob/master/stb_vorbis.c) - Ogg Vorbis audio decoder.
*   C: File System
    *   üéâ [HexEmbed (‚≠ê50)](https://github.com/codeplea/hexembed) - Small utility to help embed files in C/C++ programs in an easy, cross-platform way.
    *   ‚≠ê [Incbin (‚≠ê1.1k)](https://github.com/graphitemaster/incbin) - Include binary and text files in your C/C++ apps with ease.
    *   üéâ [PhysicsFS (‚≠ê643)](https://github.com/icculus/physfs) - Portable, flexible file I/O abstraction. Provides access to various archives.
    *   ‚≠ê [Where Am I (‚≠ê495)](https://github.com/gpakosz/whereami) - Locates the current path on the local file system.
*   C: Fonts
    *   üéâ [Font Stash (‚≠ê722)](https://github.com/memononen/fontstash) - Lightweight library that uses stb\_truetype to render fonts to a texture atlas.
    *   üéâ [IconFontCppHeaders (‚≠ê1.3k)](https://github.com/juliettef/IconFontCppHeaders) - C/C++ headers and C# classes for icon fonts.
    *   ‚≠ê [stb\_truetype (‚≠ê29k)](https://github.com/nothings/stb/blob/master/stb_truetype.h) - Single-header file library that processes TrueType font files.
    *   üéâ [Vertext (‚≠ê30)](https://github.com/kevinmkchin/vertext) - Generates vertices for rendering text, requires stb\_truetype.
*   C: Lighting
    *   ‚≠ê [Light Mapper (‚≠ê1.5k)](https://github.com/ands/lightmapper) - Single-file library for lightmap baking by using your existing OpenGL renderer.
*   C: Network
    *   üéâ [librg (‚≠ê1.4k)](https://github.com/zpl-c/librg) - Middleware between networking / file-streaming libraries and app logic.

### Libraries / C++

*   C++: Entity Component System
    *   üéâ [EntityX (‚≠ê2.3k)](https://github.com/alecthomas/entityx) - Fast, type-safe C++ entity component system.
    *   üéâ [Entt (‚≠ê11k)](https://github.com/skypjack/entt) - Gaming meets modern C++, a fast and reliable entity component system.
*   C++: Geometry
    *   üéâ [CinoLib (‚≠ê1k)](https://github.com/mlivesu/cinolib) - Header-only library for processing polygonal and polyhedral meshes.
    *   üéâ [Delabella (‚≠ê236)](https://github.com/msokalski/delabella) - Super stable 2D delaunay triangulation.
    *   üéâ [Delaunator-Cpp (‚≠ê0)](https://github.com/soerendd/delaunator-cpp) - Really fast library for Delaunay triangulation of 2D points.
    *   üîí [Easy3D (‚≠ê1.5k)](https://github.com/LiangliangNan/Easy3D) - Easy-to-use library for 3D modeling, geometry processing, and rendering.
    *   üéâ [Extrude (‚≠ê22)](https://github.com/stevinz/extrude) - Converts 2D images into 3D extruded meshes.
    *   üîí [Generator (‚≠ê226)](https://github.com/ilmola/generator) - Procedural geometry generation library for C++11.
    *   üéâ [Geometric Tools](https://www.geometrictools.com/index.html) - Mathematics, geometry, graphics, image analysis and physics in C++14.
    *   üéâ [GeometronLib (‚≠ê97)](https://github.com/LukasBanana/GeometronLib) - Meshes for 3D shapes (cube, sphere, etc.) and ray / geometry intersection.
    *   üîí [Libigl (‚≠ê4.8k)](https://github.com/libigl/libigl) - Simple geometry processing library.
    *   üéâ [MeshOptimizer (‚≠ê6.4k)](https://github.com/zeux/meshoptimizer) - Mesh optimization library that makes meshes smaller and faster to render.
    *   üéâ [Polygon Mesh Processing Library (‚≠ê1.4k)](https://github.com/pmp-library/pmp-library) - Processing / visualizing polygon surface meshes.
    *   üéâ [PolyPartition (‚≠ê682)](https://github.com/ivanfratric/polypartition) - 2D polygon partitioning and triangulation.
    *   ‚≠ê [RamerDouglasPeucker](https://gist.github.com/TimSC/0813573d77734bcb6f2cd2cf6cc7aa51) - Reduces number of points along a 2D line.
    *   üéâ [Recast & Detour (‚≠ê7.1k)](https://github.com/recastnavigation/recastnavigation) - Navigation-mesh toolset for games.
    *   üéâ [Seam-aware Decimater (‚≠ê514)](https://github.com/songrun/SeamAwareDecimater) - Simplifies mesh while preserving UVs, based on [Seamless](https://cragl.cs.gmu.edu/seamless/).
    *   üéâ [Spheres (‚≠ê268)](https://github.com/caosdoar/spheres) - Four methods to create a sphere mesh.
    *   üîí [Trimesh2](https://gfx.cs.princeton.edu/proj/trimesh2/) - Utilities for input, output, and manipulation of 3D triangle meshes.
    *   üéâ [V-HACD (‚≠ê1.5k)](https://github.com/kmammou/v-hacd) - Decomposes a 3D surface into a set of "near" convex parts.
*   C++: Lighting
    *   üéâ [Thekla Atlas (‚≠ê475)](https://github.com/Thekla/thekla_atlas) - Atlas generation tool.
    *   üéâ [UVAtlas (‚≠ê880)](https://github.com/Microsoft/UVAtlas) - DirectX library for creating and packing texture atlases.
*   C++: Utility
    *   üéâ [Any-Lite (‚≠ê143)](https://github.com/martinmoene/any-lite) - Header-only 'any' type for C++98 and above.
    *   üéâ [EASTL (‚≠ê8.8k)](https://github.com/electronicarts/EASTL/) - Electronic Arts STL replacement, emphasis on performance.
    *   üéâ [faker-cxx (‚≠ê365)](https://github.com/cieslarmichal/faker-cxx) - C++20 Faker library for generating fake (but realistic) data for testing and development.
    *   üéâ [Parallel Hashmap (‚≠ê3k)](https://github.com/greg7mdp/parallel-hashmap) - Header-only, fast and memory-friendly hashmap and binary tree containers.
    *   üéâ [Spdlog (‚≠ê27k)](https://github.com/gabime/spdlog) - Fast logging library.
    *   üéâ [Tiny-Process-Library](https://gitlab.com/eidheim/tiny-process-library) - Making it simple to create and stop new processes.
    *   üéâ [TinyXML-2 (‚≠ê5.4k)](https://github.com/leethomason/tinyxml2) - XML parser that can be easily integrated into other programs.
*   C++: Visual Programming / Nodes
    *   üéâ [NodeEditor (‚≠ê3.4k)](https://github.com/paceholder/nodeeditor) - Graph-controlled data processing, built with *Qt*.
    *   üéâ [QuickQanava (‚≠ê1.3k)](https://github.com/cneben/QuickQanava) - Display graphs and relational content in a *QtQuick*-based app, in C++14.
    *   üéâ [Visual Script Engine (‚≠ê203)](https://github.com/kovacsv/VisualScriptEngine) - Visual scripting engine designed for embedding.

### Libraries / C#

*   C#: App Framework
    *   üéâ [ATF (‚≠ê1.9k)](https://github.com/SonyWWS/ATF) - Components for making tools on Windows, started in 2005.
*   C#: Audio
    *   üéâ [NAudio (‚≠ê5.9k)](https://github.com/naudio/NAudio) - Audio and MIDI library for .NET.
*   C#: Game Engine w/Editor
    *   üéâ [Duality (‚≠ê1.4k)](https://github.com/AdamsLair/duality) - Modular 2D engine, editor built with *OpenTK*.
    *   üéâ [Flat Red Ball (‚≠ê486)](https://github.com/vchelaru/FlatRedBall) - 2D game engine & design tools, built with *MonoGame*. \[[Website](https://flatredball.com/)]
    *   üéâ [Murder (‚≠ê2.9k)](https://github.com/isadorasophia/murder) - Pixel-art, ECS game engine built on *MonoGame*. \[[Docs](https://isadorasophia.com/murder/)]
    *   üéâ [Stride (‚≠ê7k)](https://github.com/stride3d/stride) - Game engine for realistic rendering and VR. Formerly *Xenko*. \[[Website](https://www.stride3d.net/)]
    *   üí∏ [Unity](https://store.unity.com/) - Biggest name in game engines, industry standard.

### Libraries / Haxe

*   Haxe: App Framework
    *   üéâ [Lime (‚≠ê799)](https://github.com/haxelime/lime) - Flexible, lightweight layer for Haxe cross-platform developers.
    *   üéâ [nme (‚≠ê489)](https://github.com/haxenme/nme) - Cross-platform native backend for Haxe projects.
*   Haxe: Serialization / Storage
    *   üéâ [CastleDB (‚≠ê581)](https://github.com/ncannasse/castle) - Structured database with a local web service to edit it.
    *   üéâ [Format (‚≠ê135)](https://github.com/HaxeFoundation/format) - Various files formats support for Haxe.
    *   üéâ [HxBit (‚≠ê160)](https://github.com/HeapsIO/hxbit) - Binary serialization and network synchronization library.
*   Haxe: Utility
    *   üéâ [hexMachina (‚≠ê6)](https://github.com/DoclerLabs/hexCore) - Powerful modular MVC framework. \[[Website](http://hexmachina.org/)]
    *   üéâ [HxColorToolkit (‚≠ê45)](https://github.com/andyli/hxColorToolkit) - Library for color conversion and color scheme generation.
    *   üéâ [HxMath (‚≠ê91)](https://github.com/tbrosman/hxmath) - Game-oriented math library for the Haxe language.
    *   üéâ [SteamWrap (‚≠ê114)](https://github.com/larsiusprime/SteamWrap) - Haxe native extension for the Steam API.
*   Haxe: Visual Programming / Nodes
    *   üéâ [Haxe-Blockly (‚≠ê5)](https://github.com/nickmain/haxe-blockly) - Haxe wrapper for [Blockly](https://developers.google.com/blockly)

### Libraries / JavaScript

*   JavaScript: Entity Component System
    *   üéâ [Becsy (‚≠ê251)](https://github.com/LastOliveGames/becsy) - Multithreaded ECS for TypeScript and JavaScript.
    *   üîí [bitECS (‚≠ê1.1k)](https://github.com/NateTheGreatt/bitECS) - Functional, minimal, data-oriented, ultra-high performance ECS library.
    *   üéâ [Ecsy (‚≠ê1.1k)](https://github.com/ecsyjs/ecsy) - Experimental ECS aiming to be lightweight, easy to use.
    *   üéâ [Miniplex (‚≠ê924)](https://github.com/hmans/miniplex) - Entity management system for games.
*   JavaScript: File Formats
    *   üéâ [JSMpeg (‚≠ê6.5k)](https://github.com/phoboslab/jsmpeg) - MPEG1 Video Decoder in JavaScript.
*   JavaScript: Graphics - 3D
    *   üéâ [Babylon.js (‚≠ê24k)](https://github.com/BabylonJS/Babylon.js) üî• - Powerful web rendering engine. \[[Extensions (‚≠ê181)](https://github.com/BabylonJS/Extensions) | [Website](https://www.babylonjs.com/)]
    *   üéâ [ClayGL (‚≠ê2.8k)](https://github.com/pissang/claygl) - WebGL library for scalable Web3D applications.
    *   üéâ [CopperLicht](https://ambiera.com/copperlicht/) - A 3D library for WebGL. \[[CopperCube Editor](https://ambiera.com/coppercube/index.html)]
    *   üéâ [Filament for Web (‚≠ê19k)](https://github.com/google/filament/tree/main/web/filament-js) - WebAssembly build of Google's 3D graphics library, Filament. \[[Demos](https://google.github.io/filament/webgl/)]
    *   üéâ [Four (‚≠ê336)](https://github.com/CodyJasonBennett/four) - Minimal three.js alternative.
    *   üéâ [Hilo3d (‚≠ê658)](https://github.com/hiloteam/Hilo3d) - WebGL 3D rendering engine by *Alibaba*.
    *   üéâ [Litescene.js (‚≠ê375)](https://github.com/jagenjo/litescene.js) - WebGL 3D engine library, used by WebGLStudio.
    *   üéâ [LUME (‚≠ê1.4k)](https://github.com/lume/lume) - Simplifies the creation of interactive 2D/3D experiences.
    *   ‚≠ê [OGL (‚≠ê4.1k)](https://github.com/oframe/ogl) üî• - Fast, powerful, minimal WebGL library. \[[Examples](https://oframe.github.io/ogl/examples)]
    *   üéâ [PicoGL.js (‚≠ê795)](https://github.com/tsherif/picogl.js) - Minimal WebGL 2 rendering library. \[[Examples](https://tsherif.github.io/picogl.js/)]
    *   üéâ [Pixi3D (‚≠ê795)](https://github.com/jnsmalm/pixi3d) - 3D renderer for *PixiJS*, seamless integration with 2D apps. \[[Examples](https://pixi3d.org/)]
    *   üéâ [RedGL (‚≠ê157)](https://github.com/redcamel/RedGL2) - JavaScript 3D WebGL library.
    *   üéâ [Regl (‚≠ê5.4k)](https://github.com/regl-project/regl) - Fast functional WebGL.
    *   üéâ [SwissGL (‚≠ê1.2k)](https://github.com/google/swissgl) - Minimalistic wrapper on top of WebGL2.
    *   üéâ [ThingJS (‚≠ê199)](https://github.com/uinosoft/t3d.js) - Lightweight, extendable 3D library, aka *t3d*.
    *   üéâ [Three.js (‚≠ê108k)](https://github.com/mrdoob/three.js/) üî• - General-purpose 3D library. \[[Awesome (‚≠ê765)](https://github.com/0xAxiome/awesome-threejs) | [Docs](https://threejs.org) | [Editor](https://threejs.org/editor/) | [Examples](https://threejs.org/examples/)]
    *   üéâ [TWGL (‚≠ê2.8k)](https://github.com/greggman/twgl.js) - Tiny WebGL helper Library. \[[Examples](http://twgljs.org/)]
    *   üìö [WebGL Frameworks](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_WebGL_frameworks) - List of WebGL frameworks on Wikipedia.
    *   üìö [WebGL / WebGPU Frameworks](https://gist.github.com/76878ba6903cf15789b712464875cfdc) -  List of WebGL and WebGPU frameworks and libraries.
    *   üéâ [x3dom (‚≠ê842)](https://github.com/x3dom/x3dom) - Integrate 3D content seamlessly into your webpage.
*   JavaScript: Layout
    *   üìö [Complete Guide to Flexbox](https://css-tricks.com/snippets/css/a-guide-to-flexbox/) - Comprehensive guide to CSS flexbox layout.
    *   üìö [Complete Guide to Grid](https://css-tricks.com/snippets/css/complete-guide-grid/) - Comprehensive guide to CSS grid.
*   JavaScript: Networking
    *   üéâ [Socket.io (‚≠ê62k)](https://github.com/socketio/socket.io) - Enables real-time bidirectional event-based communication.
    *   üéâ [WebRTC](https://webrtc.org/) - Supports video, voice, and generic data to be sent between peers.
*   JavaScript: Utility
    *   üéâ [Clipboard.js (‚≠ê34k)](https://github.com/zenorocha/clipboard.js) - Small, modern copy to clipboard.
    *   üéâ [Day.js (‚≠ê48k)](https://github.com/iamkun/dayjs) - Fast 2kB alternative to [Moment.js (‚≠ê48k)](https://github.com/moment/moment) with the same modern API.
    *   üéâ [i18next (‚≠ê8.2k)](https://github.com/i18next/i18next) - Popular internationalization framework.
    *   üéâ [jQuery (‚≠ê60k)](https://github.com/jquery/jquery) - Fast and feature-rich JavaScript library. \[[Website](https://jquery.com)]
    *   üéâ [PreloadJS (‚≠ê2.9k)](https://github.com/CreateJS/PreloadJS) - Preloading assets w/progress events.
    *   üéâ [Struct Vec (‚≠ê27)](https://github.com/moomoolive/struct-vec) - JavaScript array-like containers for multithreading.

### Libraries / Pascal

*   Pascal: Game Framework
    *   üéâ [Apus (‚≠ê178)](https://github.com/Cooler2/ApusGameEngine) - Cross-platform library for making 2D games.
*   Pascal: Physics
    *   üéâ [Kraft (‚≠ê118)](https://github.com/BeRo1985/kraft) - Object Pascal 3D physics engine.

### Libraries / Python

*   Python: Cross-Platform
    *   üí∏ [Anvil](https://anvil.works) - Full stack web apps with nothing but Python.
    *   üéâ [Brython (‚≠ê6.5k)](https://github.com/brython-dev/brython) - Python 3 running in the browser.

### Libraries / Zig

*   Zig: File System
    *   üéâ [Known Folders (‚≠ê265)](https://github.com/ziglibs/known-folders) - Provides access to well-known folders across several operating systems.

### Open Source Games / C

*   üí∏ [Handmade Hero](https://handmadehero.org/) - Videos on making a game from start to finish, source code for $15.

### Open Source Games / C++

*   üîí [Doom 3 (‚≠ê3.3k)](https://github.com/id-Software/DOOM-3) - Doom 3 GPL source release.

### Open Source Games / Java

*   üîí [Pixel Dungeon (‚≠ê3.7k)](https://github.com/watabou/pixel-dungeon) - Traditional roguelike game with pixel-art graphics and simple interface.

### Specialty Topics / AI / Pathfinding

*   üìö [Beginner's Guide to Game AI](https://www.gamedev.net/tutorials/programming/artificial-intelligence/the-total-beginners-guide-to-game-ai-r4942/) - Intro to concepts used in AI for games.

### Specialty Topics / Color Manipulation

*   üìö [How to Choose Colors Procedurally](http://devmag.org.za/2012/07/29/how-to-choose-colours-procedurally-algorithms/) - Procedural palettes and how to generate them.

### Specialty Topics / Fluid / Smoke

*   üìö [Fluid Simulation on the GPU](https://developer.nvidia.com/gpugems/gpugems/part-vi-beyond-triangles/chapter-38-fast-fluid-dynamics-simulation-gpu) - GPU Gems Chapter 38 - Fast, stable fluid simulation on the GPU.

### Specialty Topics / Lighting / Shadows

*   Gamma
    *   üìö [What Every Coder Should Know About Gamma](https://blog.johnnovak.net/2016/09/21/what-every-coder-should-know-about-gamma/) - Light emission vs perceptual brightness.
*   Shadows 2D
    *   üìö [2D Pixel Perfect Shadows (‚≠ê1.9k)](https://github.com/mattdesl/lwjgl-basics/wiki/2D-Pixel-Perfect-Shadows) - An approach to 2D pixel-perfect lights / shadows using shaders.
    *   üìö [2D Visibility](https://www.redblobgames.com/articles/visibility/) - Excellent interactive tutorial on 2D visibility.
    *   üìö [Fast 2D shadows in Unity](https://www.gamedeveloper.com/programming/fast-2d-shadows-in-unity-using-1d-shadow-mapping) - Adapting 3D rendering techniques to achieve fast 2D shadows.
    *   üìö [Sight & Light](https://ncase.me/sight-and-light/) - How to create 2D visibility / shadow effects for your game. \[[Source (‚≠ê1.1k)](https://github.com/ncase/sight-and-light)]
    *   üìö [Symmetric Shadowcasting](https://www.albertford.com/shadowcasting/) - Common technique for calculating field of view.
*   Shadows 3D
    *   üìö [Efficient Soft-Edged Shadows](https://developer.nvidia.com/gpugems/gpugems2/part-ii-shading-lighting-and-shadows/chapter-17-efficient-soft-edged-shadows-using) - GPU Gems 2 Chapter 17.
    *   üìö [Screen Space Shadows](https://panoskarabelas.com/posts/screen_space_shadows/) - Great exploration of screen space shadows.
    *   üìö [Shadow Mapping](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shadow_mapping) - Shadow mapping and the techniques used to acheive it.

### Specialty Topics / Physics

*   Platformer
    *   üìö [2D Physics Games](https://www.gamedeveloper.com/design/how-to-create-2d-physics-games-with-box2d-library) - Using Box2D for water, ropes, gravity, lines, vehicles, etc.
    *   üìö [Basic 2D Platformer Physics](https://gamedevelopment.tutsplus.com/series/basic-2d-platformer-physics--cms-998) - How to create a physics system for a platformer.
*   Water / Buoyancy
    *   üìö [2D Water](https://prime31.github.io/water2d-part1/) - Modeling 2D water with springs.

### Specialty Topics / Rendering

*   üìö [GPU Driven Rendering](https://vkguide.dev/docs/gpudriven/gpu_driven_engines/) - Calculating rendering on the GPU in compute shaders.
*   üìö [Model Batching](https://webglfundamentals.org/webgl/lessons/webgl-qna-drawing-many-different-models-in-a-single-draw-call.html) - Drawing many different models in a single draw call.

### Specialty Topics / Scripting

*   üìö [Adding Languages to Game Engines](https://www.gamedeveloper.com/programming/adding-languages-to-game-engines) - Story of adding scripting to a game.
*   üìö [Implementing a Scripting Engine](https://www.flipcode.com/archives/Implementing_A_Scripting_Engine-Part_1_Overview.shtml) - Writting a scripting engine from scratch.
*   üìö [Embedded Scripting Languages](https://caiorss.github.io/C-Cpp-Notes/embedded_scripting_languages.html) - Scripting languages and engines available as libraries.
*   üìö [List of Embedded Scripting Languages (‚≠ê1.4k)](https://github.com/dbohdan/embedded-scripting-languages) - Scripting languages to use in your app / game.
*   üìö [Scriptorium (‚≠ê512)](https://github.com/r-lyeh-archived/scriptorium) - Game scripting languages benchmarked.

### Specialty Topics / Shaders

*   Fire
    *   üìö [Fire Shader in GLSL](https://clockworkchilli.com/blog/8_a_fire_shader_in_glsl_for_your_webgl_games) - Fire intro shader using noise textures and masking.
    *   üåé [Simplex 3D Noise](https://www.shadertoy.com/view/MllfDn) - Simplex noise fire simulation shader at ShaderToy.
*   Upscaling
    *   üìö [How do I perform an xBR or hqx filter in XNA?](https://gamedev.stackexchange.com/questions/87275/how-do-i-perform-an-xbr-or-hqx-filter-in-xna/87821#87821) - Upscaling shader code.
    *   üìö [hqx](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hqx) - Wikipedia article about the hqx pixel art upscaling algorithm developed by Maxim Stepin.
*   Wireframe
    *   üìö [Flat and Wireframe Shading](https://catlikecoding.com/unity/tutorials/advanced-rendering/flat-and-wireframe-shading/) - Flat shading / wireframes using Barycentric Coordinates.

### Specialty Topics / Signed Distance Fields

*   üìö [Basic 2D SDFs](https://www.ronja-tutorials.com/post/034-2d-sdf-basics/) - Basics of rendering 2D shapes with SDFs in shaders.
*   üìö [Bezier Strokes](https://vladjuckov.github.io/beziers-sdf/) - Blog post on rendering bezier strokes with SDFs.
*   üìö [Signed Distance Field Resources (‚≠ê703)](https://github.com/CedricGuillemet/SDF) - Tutorials, papers, software, demos, discussions, etc.
*   üéâ [SDF Mesh Generation (‚≠ê1.7k)](https://github.com/fogleman/sdf) - Python API to generate 3D meshes with SDFs.

### Specialty Topics / Tiling

*   üìö [List of Eucliden Uniform Tilings](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Euclidean_uniform_tilings) - Wikipedia article on uniform tiling, space-filling polygons.

### Tools / Software / 2D Game Dev

*   üí∞ [Sprite Illuminator](https://www.codeandweb.com/spriteilluminator) - Create stunning light effects with 2D sprites in your game engine.
*   üí∞ [Texture Packer](https://www.codeandweb.com/texturepacker) - Create sprite sheets and optimize your game graphics.

### Tools / Software / Animation Software

*   üí∏ [Cascadeur](https://cascadeur.com) - 3D animation software for physics-based character animation.
*   üí∏ [Spine](http://esotericsoftware.com/) - 2D animation for games.

### Tools / Software / Color / Palettes

*   üåé [Colormind](http://colormind.io) - Color scheme generator, can learn color styles from photographs, art, etc.
*   üåé [COLOURlovers](https://www.colourlovers.com) - Share colors, palettes and patterns.
*   üåé [Huemint](https://huemint.com) - Uses machine learning to generate colors for graphic design.
*   üåé [Paletton](https://paletton.com) - Explore complementary colors on the color wheel.

### Tools / Software / Generative Art

*   Sound
    *   üÜì [Dittytoy](https://dittytoy.net/) - Create generative music using a simple JavaScript API.
    *   üÜì [Sonic Pi (‚≠ê11k)](https://github.com/sonic-pi-net/sonic-pi) - Kind of musical instrument where you code music.

### Tools / Software / Materials / Textures

*   üí∏ [PixPlant](https://www.pixplant.com/index.php) - Tool to allow simple creation of tiling 3D materials.

### Tools / Software / Pixel Art

*   üí∞ [Fluid FX](https://codemanu.itch.io/fluid-fx) - Uses fluid simulation to achieve animations like explosions, blood, smoke, etc.
*   üí∞ [Juice FX](https://codemanu.itch.io/juicefx) - Add style to your sprites and animations with ease.
*   üí∞ [PixaTool](https://kronbits.itch.io/pixatool) - Create pixel art by converting your images, sprites or videos.

### Tools / Software / Vector Editors

*   üí∞ [Vec Maker](https://kronbits.itch.io/vecmaker) - Easy to use vector design.

### Tools / Software / Voxel

*   üí∞ [Ken Shape](https://tools.kenney.nl/kenshape/) - Draw in 2D, set the depth for each pixel and generate 3D models!

### Video Game Assets / Audio Assets

*   Music
    *   üÜì [BandLab Sounds](https://www.bandlab.com/sounds/home) - High-quality loops and packs used for music creation.
    *   üí∏ [Bensound](https://www.bensound.com/royalty-free-music) - Original music tracks, free with attribution. Perfect for games.
    *   üí∏ [Incompetech](https://incompetech.com/wordpress/) - Nice collection of game tracks. Buy or attribution required.
    *   üí∏ [Melody Loops](https://www.melodyloops.com/music/free/) - Nice mix of free and affordable music loops.
    *   üí∏ [Soundimage](https://soundimage.org/looping-music/) - Looping music tracks for videogames. Buy or attribution required.

### Video Game Assets / Model Assets

*   üÜì [Poly Pizza](https://poly.pizza) - Build something beautiful with thousands of free low poly models.
*   üí∏ [Sketchfab](https://sketchfab.com) - Huge library of 3D assets.
items.content_html:
Game Engines / Awesome Collections

  • üìö Wikipedia: List of Game Engines - Game engines along with their platforms and licenses.

Game Engines / AAA

  • üí∞ C4 Engine - Modern console engine.
  • üí∞ Gamebryo - Complete toolset, flexible workflow, rapid prototyping.
  • üí∏ Unigine - Real-time 3D engine. Photorealistic graphics, large virtual worlds, C++ and C# API.

Game Engines / Commercial

  • üí∏ Buildbox - Create 3D & 2D video games without coding.
  • üí∏ GameSalad - Sophisticated visual programming interface.
  • üí∏ MANU - Unique animation system helps you create games without coding.
  • üí∏ Roblox - Create immersive 3D experiences with Lua scripting.
  • üí∏ Simulation Starter Kit - Create interactive 3D apps across a range of platforms.

Game Engines / Specialty

  • üîí HARFANG 3D (‚≠ê620) - 3D visualization library for industry professionals, usable in C++, Python, Lua, Go.
  • üí∞ RPG Maker - Create an original role-playing game without any specialized knowledge.

Learning / Computer Graphics

  • Blog Articles
    • üìö Comparison of Modern Graphics APIs - Modern graphics APIs vs older APIs.
    • üìö GPU Performance for Game Artists - Common art-related performance issues.
  • Graphics API: DirectX
    • üåé DirectX - Microsoft API used to create 2D/3D games and apps. [Blog | Samples (‚≠ê6.5k)]
    • üìö DirectXTutorial.com - Older resource with lots of tutorials on DirectX versions 9 & 11.
  • Graphics API: OpenGL
    • üìö LearnOpenGL üî• - Incredible! In depth tutorials for modern graphics programming.
    • üåé Mesa 3D - Open source implementations of OpenGL.
    • üåé OpenGL - The industry's foundation for high-performance graphics.
    • üìö OpenGL Tutorial - Collection of OpenGL tutorials with source code examples.
  • Graphics API: Vulkan
    • üåé Vulkan - Modern cross-platform graphics API. [Samples (‚≠ê4.8k)]
    • üìö Vulkan Tutorial - Teaches the basics of using Vulkan graphics and compute API.
  • Graphics API: WebGL
    • üåé WebGL - Open web standard 3D graphics API. [GitHub (‚≠ê2.7k)]
    • üìö WebGL Fundamentals üî• - Full understanding of what WebGL really is and how it works.
    • üìö WebGL 2 Fundamentals - Updated to use the WebGL2 standard.
    • üìö WebGL 2 Samples (‚≠ê1k) - Short and easy to understand samples demonstrating WebGL 2 features.
    • üìö WebGL Tutorial - How to use the canvas element to draw WebGL graphics.

Learning / Engine Development

  • Blog Articles
    • üìö How to Become a Game Engine Developer - Starting point on game engine development.
  • Books
    • üìö Game Engine Architecture - Theory and practice of game engine development.

Learning / Game Development

  • Awesome Collections
    • üìö Awesome Gamedev (‚≠ê2.7k) - Collection of free resources for making games.
    • üìö GameDev-Resources (‚≠ê4.3k) - Wonderful list of game development resources.
    • üìö Magictools (‚≠ê15k) - List of game development resources to make magic happen.
    • üåé Web Game Dev - Resources on techniques and tools around JavaScript game development.
  • Books
    • üìö Art of Game Design - Teaches game design in an accessible manner.
    • üìö Game Programming Patterns - Patterns found in games that make code easier to understand.
  • Developer Portals
    • üåé Game Developer - Industry blogs, events, jobs, updates and more. Formerly Gamasutra.
    • üåé GameDev.net - Game dev forums, tutorials, blogs, projects, portfolios, and news.
    • üåé GameFromScratch.com - Game dev news, tutorials and much more.
    • üåé itch.io - Game dev resources and platform to showcase / promote / buy & sell games.
  • Education Portals
    • üåé Lazy Foo' Tutorials - Beginning game programming with SDL.

Learning / Programming

  • üìö Big-O Cheat Sheet - Big-O complexities of algorithms used in computer science.
  • üåé Deadlock Empire - Interactive tutorial to master threads and concurrency.
  • üìö Every Programmer Should Know (‚≠ê87k) - Technical things every developer should know.
  • üìö Games of Coding (‚≠ê2k) - Games that teach you a programming language.
  • üåé Geeks for Geeks - Tutorials, articles, courses, coding competitions, jobs and more.
  • üìö Learn to Program (‚≠ê4.4k) - Educational resources to learn to program.

Libraries / C

  • C: Cross-Platform
    • üéâ Cosmopolitan (‚≠ê20k) - Build-once run-anywhere C library.
  • C: Entity Component System
    • üéâ Flecs (‚≠ê7.3k) - Fast and lightweight entity component system in C99.
  • C: File Formats
    • üéâ Assimp (‚≠ê12k) - Open Asset Importer Library. Loads 40+ 3D file formats.
    • üéâ cgltf (‚≠ê1.6k) - Single-file glTF 2.0 loader and writer in C99.
    • ‚≠ê dr_libs (‚≠ê1.4k) - Single-file audio decoding libraries.
    • üéâ Libspng (‚≠ê789) - Simple, modern libpng alternative.
    • üéâ Miniz (‚≠ê2.4k) - Single-file drop-in replacement for zlib's most used APIs (libpng and libzip).
    • üéâ OBJ GL Loader v2 (‚≠ê12) - Quite fast wavefront OBJ loader for OpenGL.
    • üéâ PL_MPEG (‚≠ê857) - Single-file library for decoding MPEG1 Video and MP2 Audio.
    • üéâ QOI (‚≠ê7.2k) - The ‚ÄúQuite OK Image Format‚Äù for fast, lossless image compression.
    • ‚≠ê stb_vorbis (‚≠ê29k) - Ogg Vorbis audio decoder.
  • C: File System
    • üéâ HexEmbed (‚≠ê50) - Small utility to help embed files in C/C++ programs in an easy, cross-platform way.
    • ‚≠ê Incbin (‚≠ê1.1k) - Include binary and text files in your C/C++ apps with ease.
    • üéâ PhysicsFS (‚≠ê643) - Portable, flexible file I/O abstraction. Provides access to various archives.
    • ‚≠ê Where Am I (‚≠ê495) - Locates the current path on the local file system.
  • C: Fonts
    • üéâ Font Stash (‚≠ê722) - Lightweight library that uses stb_truetype to render fonts to a texture atlas.
    • üéâ IconFontCppHeaders (‚≠ê1.3k) - C/C++ headers and C# classes for icon fonts.
    • ‚≠ê stb_truetype (‚≠ê29k) - Single-header file library that processes TrueType font files.
    • üéâ Vertext (‚≠ê30) - Generates vertices for rendering text, requires stb_truetype.
  • C: Lighting
    • ‚≠ê Light Mapper (‚≠ê1.5k) - Single-file library for lightmap baking by using your existing OpenGL renderer.
  • C: Network
    • üéâ librg (‚≠ê1.4k) - Middleware between networking / file-streaming libraries and app logic.

Libraries / C++

  • C++: Entity Component System
    • üéâ EntityX (‚≠ê2.3k) - Fast, type-safe C++ entity component system.
    • üéâ Entt (‚≠ê11k) - Gaming meets modern C++, a fast and reliable entity component system.
  • C++: Geometry
    • üéâ CinoLib (‚≠ê1k) - Header-only library for processing polygonal and polyhedral meshes.
    • üéâ Delabella (‚≠ê236) - Super stable 2D delaunay triangulation.
    • üéâ Delaunator-Cpp (‚≠ê0) - Really fast library for Delaunay triangulation of 2D points.
    • üîí Easy3D (‚≠ê1.5k) - Easy-to-use library for 3D modeling, geometry processing, and rendering.
    • üéâ Extrude (‚≠ê22) - Converts 2D images into 3D extruded meshes.
    • üîí Generator (‚≠ê226) - Procedural geometry generation library for C++11.
    • üéâ Geometric Tools - Mathematics, geometry, graphics, image analysis and physics in C++14.
    • üéâ GeometronLib (‚≠ê97) - Meshes for 3D shapes (cube, sphere, etc.) and ray / geometry intersection.
    • üîí Libigl (‚≠ê4.8k) - Simple geometry processing library.
